titleStmt.title: At the second sessions of the general court held at Boston in New-England. Whereas it hath pleased His Most Excellent Majesty our gratious King, by his letter bearing date the twenty seventh of April, 1678. to signifie his royal pleasure, that the authority of this his colony of Massachusetts in New-England, do give forth orders that the oath of allegiance as it is by law established within his kingdome of England, be administered and taken by all his subjects within this colony, who are of years to take an oath ...
titleStmt.author: Massachusetts. General Court.

notesStmt.note: Signed: "Printed and published by order of the general court. Edward Rawson Secr."
Place and date of publication suggested by Wing (2nd ed.).
Reproduction of original in: Massachusetts Historical Society Library.
